CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 16, 1953, pg. 27, reads: "Know Their Marbles - Frank Moore, left, of 1501 Sedgwick Street, and Melvin Lewis, 14, of 1111 Liverpool Street, came through in grand style was week as the won the Bureau of Recreation Marbles Tournament, co-sponsored by Gimbel's Department Store. Moore, 13, received $25 for his winning efforts while Lewis was given $10 for placing second.  Moore demonstrates his shooting skill to Stephen A. Bodner, director of the Manchester Recreation Center, the branch both boys represented. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of 1953 city of Pittsburgh marbles champion Frank Moore, second place winner Melvin Lewis, and director of Manchester Recreation Center Stephan A. Bodnar, kneeling over marbles, in interior
